messages.title: Local Support
messages.content: Robert Holland, Local Pensioner, says: "Claire is a breath of fresh air. A good listener; she will work for us, our families and the public services we rely on in Skipton & Ripon."

messages.title: Labour’s Achievements Here
messages.content: High quality & reliable healthcare, Investment & success in education, Crime reduced & safer neighbourhoods.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: To ensure that businesses and individuals receive the support and guidance they need to develop and succeed in the labour market
From renewable energy sources to district recycling, more needs to be done to protect our children from toxic fumes and improve our carbon credentials
Work to protect local schools, make sure they are equipped to learn and facilities for people of all ages
Have a passion to ensure that all parents and pupils receive the best education in this country's school system
Will engage directly with you when important decisions are being made about your neighbourhood by holding open public town hall meetings

issues.education: 420 more teachers and teaching assistants, funding for Sure Start centres & more than 40% extra spending per pupil in the area.
issues.health: Waiting lists are at an all time low for local NHS services, well-funded by Labour. There is now no one waiting more than 13 weeks for treatment in Airedale, down from 480 people in 1997.

leaflet.personalStatement: With David Curry MP's retirement, comes a real choice. A vote for me is to secure the economic recovery, protect our services, clean up politics, and create a local future fair for all. I hope you share this vision for Skipton and Ripon, and I look forward to working on the key issues that matter most to you.

contactInformation.address: 1 Sandy Lane, Embsay, Skipton, North Yorkshire, BD23 6PD

images.caption: Claire outside Skipton Library on the High Street
Claire Hazelgrove - Your Labour Candidate for Skipton & Ripon
